name: 8.4 "How to Marry a Mailman" Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 8 | 10 Questions

questions.text: How much did Robin's drink cost in the beginning of the episode?
questions.explanation:
$75.

	His drink was called a Louis the 13th and was some type of brandy. Cliff paid for the drink not realizing it was going to cost quite so much. I googled to see how much this drink really does cost and it said that a bottle of it cost $2000 in 2012; back in the '90s it may have cost a little less since it wasn't quite as old.

questions.text: Who had a band-aid on their head?
questions.explanation:
Frasier.

	Frasier was flirting in Lamaze class and Lilith didn't like it. She called it "the incident".

questions.text: Why did Carla say Margaret was probably coming to see Cliff?
options: to go to bed with him
questions.explanation:
to dump him.

	Carla found it hard enough to believe anyone would be interested in Cliff when he and Maggie first got together. So, logically she was the one that assumed Margaret was coming back to dump Cliff.

questions.text: What problem did Cliff have around women he really liked?
options: not knowing what to make for dinner
questions.explanation:
hysterical blindness.

	Cliff was pouring champagne and completely missed the glasses. He asked Sam to come to his house when he had a date with Maggie so that if the blindness happened again he'd have help.

questions.text: Who was going to have plastic surgery?
questions.explanation:
Rebecca.

	She was in a fender bender car accident and the other driver was a plastic surgeon. He offered her one free surgery in exchange for not involving his insurance in the accident.

questions.text: What was the sign for Sam to leave Cliff's place?
options: "We'd like to be alone now, Sam."
questions.explanation:
"Goodnight, Sam."

	Cliff told Sam he memorized his entire apartment so if he went blind he could get around. He asked Sam not to leave until he felt he was safe. "Goodnight, Sam" was their code for Sam to leave.

Cliff & Clifford.

	Cliff had gone blind again and thought he was headed back into his apartment. Instead, he fell over the rail into the pool down below. He was okay though.

questions.text: What surgery did the person in a car accident have done?
questions.explanation:
Removed a tattoo.

	Rebecca said it was no big deal; it was just covering up a mole on her lower back. She had the mole removed as well.

Canada.

	She was actually born in the States, but in a previous episode had moved to Canada to deliver the mail. She broke a rule while in training and was not allowed to deliver the mail in the US and she said she had to deliver the mail because it's what mail carriers do.

questions.text: Cliff developed another problem at the end of the episode. What was it?
questions.explanation:
paralyzed from the waist down.

	He was able to see just fine which made Margaret feel better. However, after she left, Cliff informed the others he couldn't stand up because he was paralyzed from the waist down.
